intro: Senecio tridenticulatus, commonly known as the three-toothed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb with upright stems and basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers arranged in a head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
